title: Prediction: If Riots plan to buff tanks is just to buff their damage
body: The game will die for real for real.  At that point its just a battle royale.

I think he was just telling a joke base around the first comment, not agreeing with it.  The "room full of monkeys with typewriters" is a model for probability, where, given enough time, literally anything has a chance of happening at least once.  Idk why you assume a rioter is anymore special than anyone else to me, my opinion follows the majority of the community and therefore I have nothing important to say as the voice that I support is being expressed and heard by the staff already.

I appreciate you joking about that, but seriously, why is that kind of content allowed? If Anatera was saying that about a fellow player, they would be severely punished. Why are they allowed to say it about Riot employees? That's just... weird. Not to mention it's a big reason the ambiance on these boards can be so toxic at times....

Customer service is a bit different than regular interpersonal interactions.  I work as a waiter, so I definitely agree that it sucks when people say things like that to employees, but ultimately people should be allowed to express their discontent with a service.  Flinging insults at the person whose job is essentially to please you (it's not actually their job to please you, specifically, but so to speak) isn't the same as insulting a random person you met.
It's a little hard to explain, so I'm sorry if that answer sounds unsatisfying.

I understand what you say, no worries. But I simply don't agree. Flinging insults is never acceptable, and expressing your discontent can be done in a civil and constructive manner. Riot has the legal rights and the technical means to sanction this kind of behavior. By not doing it, they show that it's OK and only let it grow more prevalent. It's a bad idea through and through.

Yeah, and that's not a problem.

The biggest problem with tank viability has always been their lack of damage. Their lack of damage makes them vulnerable in the jungle and unable to carry without cooperation. Their lack of damage makes their solo lane viability totter on the edge of a knife, aside from a few very specific hard counters.

The good thing with tank damage is that it they're tanks; they don't want damage. Giving them higher bases but poor scaling means that they can hold their own and even win (gasp!) early game, or punish super cocky squishies mid game (say it aint so!), while not being a real damage threat.

There's nothing wrong with a fed level 13 Nautilus being able to kill a 'normal' level 11 Ziggs if he hooks them. That's not damage creep, it's just needed damage potential for viability.
